meanings.definition: A stand or support for holding books upright.
meanings.sent1: The bookstands in the library keep the books neatly organized.
meanings.sent2: She bought new bookstands to keep her favorite novels in order.
meanings.sent3: The bookstands decided to have a race to see who could hold the most books.
meanings.sent4: The bookstands stood tall like soldiers guarding the precious books.
meanings.sent5: The bookstands resembled loyal guardians protecting the books from falling.

meanings.definition: A piece of furniture designed to hold books for display or storage.
meanings.sent1: The antique bookstands in the living room added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent2: He placed the rare collection on the bookstands to showcase them.
meanings.sent3: The bookstands threw a party for the books to celebrate their new home.
meanings.sent4: The bookstands were like treasure chests holding precious literary gems.
meanings.sent5: The bookstands gleamed in the sunlight, displaying the books beautifully.
